channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Exclusive: Revel emerges from stealth with $30 million to prevent your critical hardware from exploding—literally
item.description: Revel, a startup that builds software for controlling critical hardware, launches from stealth with $30 million in funding.

item.title: Trump Targets K-12
item.description: We explain why the president is taking on public schools, and how officials are responding.

item.title: Nvidia C.E.O. Meets With Chinese Trade Officials in Beijing
item.description: The day before the visit by Jensen Huang, lawmakers in Washington said they were investigating whether the chipmaker’s sales in China violated U.S. ru...

item.title: Netflix stock has been nearly unscathed by Trump tariffs. Some think it could be Silicon Valley’s version of Johnson & Johnson
item.description: As recession fears mount on Wall Street, management is still reportedly setting ambitious long-term goals.

item.title: Daily Pill May Work as Well as Ozempic for Weight Loss and Blood Sugar
item.description: Clinical results of a GLP-1 in pill form showed safety and efficacy data similar to blockbuster injectable drugs.

item.title: Santander surpasses UBS as continental Europe’s biggest bank
item.description: The Spanish lender has seen its shares soar in value this year, propelling it to a market capitalization of $104 billion.

item.title: Europe Seeks a Direct Line to Trump, Skeptical That Aides Speak for Him
item.description: Despite Europe’s size, economic might and longstanding alliances with Washington, Trump officials have made clear it is not a priority, European offic...

item.title: U.K. Court Ruling on Trans Women Is Part of Wider Debate on Sex and Gender
item.description: President Trump and right-wing politicians in Europe have railed against trans rights. Britain’s top court has now added its voice to the discussion.

item.title: Just before Mark Zuckerberg bought Instagram, he identified a now-defunct social startup as Facebook’s biggest threat
item.description: Emails revealed during Meta's landmark antitrust case have shed light on how Zuckerberg accessed Facebook's old rivals.

item.title: Self-made millionaire and Netflix’s finance guru Ramit Sethi reveals the financial red flags that are keeping you from getting rich
item.description: Dave Ramsey says he can tell who’ll stay stuck in the middle class just by looking at their car. Ramit Sethi thinks that’s ridiculous.

item.title: Europe Seeks a Direct Line to Trump, Skeptical That Aides Speak for Him
item.description: Despite Europe’s size, economic might and longstanding alliances with Washington, Trump officials have made clear it is not a priority, European offic...

item.title: Capybaras Make Posh Argentine Neighborhood Their Home
item.description: Over the past two years, biologists estimate the capybara population has tripled to nearly 1,000 in this gated community in Argentina.

item.title: One Town Says, Yes, You Can Have Too Many Capybaras
item.description: The world’s largest rodent is multiplying in — and dividing — one of Argentina’s most exclusive gated communities.

item.title: The Ukrainian Schoolmaster Teaching History to His Invaders
item.description: Vitalii Dribnytsia engages with Russians online to correct Kremlin propaganda about Ukraine. Over time, he has come to realize his more important audi...

item.title: U.K. Court Ruling on Trans Women Is Part of Wider Debate on Sex and Gender
item.description: President Trump and right-wing politicians in Europe have railed against trans rights. Britain’s top court has now added its voice to the discussion.
